author: Robin Burn

text:
I just beat the game. Gotta say...That was the most badass fight in a long while; coupled with this theme, and it's glorious!

Xenoblade and Last Story were fun games, but I tended to overlevel and it was too easy. This game, being more of an action game, had a more satisfying boss fight, imo.

text: A lot of Pandora's Tower's aesthetic and musical themes reminded me of Bayonetta, and between the fight itself and this music, Zeron reminded me a lot of Jubileus.

author: phalangeesh

text:
I thought this music fit the final boss perfectly. This whole game is grotesque, but it asks the question of whether one can see past the veil of the monster into the humanity inside. The whole game does this, from the monster design (shoving human faces at you at every opportunity), to the backstory behind the Masters of the 13 towers, to of course the relationship between Aeron and Elena.

This music captures that theme pretty damn well, in my opinion, while still being exciting as all hell.

text: It is true that the music fits the game's environment and anbience very well. My concern is that there are several sections in this piece that could have been a lot better, thus "not worthy" of being used along with the Liebestraum theme (which is a masterpiece indeed).

author: Colin Stokkel

text:
Pretty much everything Atlus has made on the DS never made it to Europe and adding to that, here's a lot more over the years:

Tales of: Destiny, Destiny 2, Legendia, the Abyss.
Xenogears, Xenosaga 1 & 3, Suikoden 3, FF IV took 15 years, FF VI took 13 years, Chrono Trigger took 14 years, Mario RPG took 12 years, etc etc etc.

When games don't get localiced to EU, Nobody cares. When games don't get localiced to American areas, then there is an uproar.
